dt.t: Cady stands as a direct challenge to Bowden's {wi}masculine{/wi} dominance—their first encounter in the film, for example, is when Cady shoves his hand into Bowden's car and turns off the ignition.

dt: {bc}marked by or having qualities, features, etc. traditionally associated with men

dt.t: This one's a man's watch. And though it's built for rugged, {wi}masculine{/wi} pursuits, the simple face and elegant strap lend it a suit-worthy elegance, too.
The {wi}masculine{/wi} equivalent of haute couture in suits features jackets with soft shoulders, large sleeves, neat fronts and small-notched lapels …

dt: {bc}of, relating to, or being a man or boy

dt.t: The butler these days is seen as a {wi}masculine{/wi} version of Heloise, Miss Manners and Julia Child rolled into one.

dt: {bc}of, relating to, or intended for men or boys

dt.t: A hundred years later, the finery of French court dressing had given way to the simplicity of the English squire, whose coarse tweeds and woolens set the tone for a new definition of {wi}masculine{/wi} attire.

dt: {bc}of, relating to, or constituting the gender {dx_def}see {dxt|gender:1|gender:1|1a}{/dx_def} that ordinarily includes most words or grammatical forms referring to males as well as other words and forms either systematically or arbitrarily in the same category

dt.t: The word for "cat" is feminine in German (die Katze) and {wi}masculine{/wi} in Spanish (el gato).

dt: {bc}being a stressed and usually additional final syllable after the final complete foot {dx_def}see {dxt|foot:1|foot:1|4}{/dx_def}

dt.t: The masculine {wi}cadence{/wi} resolves on the first beat of the measure and is much more conclusive than the feminine.

et: Middle English {it}masculin{/it}, from Latin {it}masculinus{/it}, from {it}masculus{/it}, noun, male, diminutive of {it}mas{/it} male
shortdef: considered to be characteristic of men : marked by or having qualities, features, etc. traditionally associated with men
of, relating to, or being a man or boy; also : of, relating to, or intended for men or boys

of, relating to, or constituting the gender that ordinarily includes most words or grammatical forms referring to males as well as other words and forms either systematically or arbitrarily in the same category

dt: {bc}the quality or nature of the male sex {bc}the quality, state, or degree of being {d_link|masculine|masculine:1} or manly

dt.t: challenging traditional notions about {wi}masculinity{/wi} and femininity
… a style which alternates between a polished grace and blunt {wi}masculinity{/wi}.
The man controlling his environment is today the prevailing American image of {wi}masculinity{/wi}.

shortdef: the quality or nature of the male sex : the quality, state, or degree of being masculine or manly
